meanings.definition: A modern interpretation of traditional Christian beliefs.
meanings.sent1: The church community embraced neoorthodoxy as a way to understand their faith better.
meanings.sent2: Many scholars study neoorthodoxy to learn about the evolution of Christian beliefs.
meanings.sent3: The debate about neoorthodoxy led to some funny misunderstandings among the congregation.
meanings.sent4: In the world of theology, neoorthodoxy stands out like a bright light in a dark room.
meanings.sent5: Learning about neoorthodoxy is like discovering a new color in a familiar painting.

meanings.definition: A movement within Protestant theology emphasizing the importance of personal faith.
meanings.sent1: Neoorthodoxy brought a fresh perspective to the Protestant theology discussions.
meanings.sent2: Personal faith plays a crucial role in the teachings of neoorthodoxy.
meanings.sent3: The idea of neoorthodoxy sometimes makes people chuckle at its simplicity.
meanings.sent4: In the realm of Protestant theology, neoorthodoxy shines like a guiding star.
meanings.sent5: The concept of neoorthodoxy sticks in your mind like a catchy tune.
